rounds.comments: (Ken: Aw, that's nice for me.  A response might be, for example, "Who is Ken Jennings?")

clues.text: It's a nearly automatic reflex reaction to a stimulus
Type of person who ruins the pleasures of others
Nickname of the NBA's all-time top scorer
Food energy has varying units of measurement; 1,000 calories equals 4,200 of these, abbreviated kJ
Works by this German existentialist philosopher & author include "Man in the Modern Age"
About 15 feet long by 4 feet wide, this linen relic has been preserved since 1578 at the cathedral of San Giovanni Battista
Taken to England in 1296, this 26x16x11 block of pale yellow sandstone has but one decoration--a Latin cross
The National Archives copy of the Articles of Confederation is written on this, much more durable than the articles
Before this rock was a classroom writing surface, it was used to make the 3000s B.C. version of friendship bracelets in Finland
A London museum has 2 of these, steel, each weighing 17 1/2 pounds, made in France, 1790-94
"Highborn kinsmen" separated her from her love & "shut her up in a sepulchre" in a "kingdom by the sea"
This lass was the daughter of Benedict Bellefontaine, "the wealthiest farmer of Grand-Pre"
Sylvia Plath titled a poem "Lady" this biblical figure; "Out of the ash I rise with my red hair"
The title ruler of this long Shelley poem drives a time chariot; the spirit of Shelley's first child is her passenger
In 1862 this sister of a painter/poet introduced us to Lizzie & Laura, both tempted by the wares of "the Goblin Market"
The title of this John Ritter sitcom refers to a list that includes "4. Bring her home late, there's no next date"
clues.response: 8 Simple Rules (for Dating My Teenage Daughter)

clues.text: It's the maiden name of "X-Files" creator Chris Carter's mother
Cat Deeley is the longtime host of this terpsichorean show
Basil Fawlty asks a hotel guest what she expected as a view in this town: "Sydney Opera House?  Hanging Gardens of Babylon?"
Hulu miniseries where Kumail Nanjiani gets rich serving up beefcake
Newspapers used this euphemistic & alliterative 2-word term to describe a 1923 attack by a white mob on a Black Florida town
In 1823 this eponymous man was elevated to superintendent of the Survey of India
In 1523 the Spanish fought a bloody battle in this C. American country & soon founded the city of Granada on a lake there
For signing a treaty with the rebellious Scots, in 1323 the earl of Carlisle met with this grisly 3-part (or un-part) punishment
Shakespeare left these 2 men a little something in his will; they repaid him by collecting his plays in the 1623 First Folio
Instructions to this Hasbro game make things pretty clear... "Your goal is simple: to take over the world"
Hoops coach Geno Auriemma has led this university to 6 undefeated seasons; one was 40-0, & the 2nd of 4 straight national titles
He eked out a win in a 2007 presidential referendum in Syria, taking 97.6% of the vote, raising the question... who dared vote against him?
You can trust us, by 1880 this company controlled the refining of at least 90% of U.S.-produced oil
Though common, this totally epoch term for the time when human activity came to dominate Earth was denied official adoption in 2024
An ideal society in the Pacific attracts the envy of the world in this author's "Island", a counterpoint to "Brave New World"
Sir Francis Bacon described a utopian domain based on science in "The New" this mythic landmass
One of the most important works by Plato, it outlines the politics & ethics of his vision of a perfect nation
What "utopia" means, it completes the title of William Morris' book about a place without politics or poverty, "News from..."
In the 10th century al-Farabi's "The Virtuous City" posited such a place in this locale, Muhammad's last home
Its name is a Mongolian word that means "waterless place"; it averages less than 8 inches of rain a year, so... nailed it
Sections of land blocked from moist air by mountain ranges are called rain these areas of darkness
Since it's near this line of latitude, 23 degrees, 27 minutes north of the equator, Aswan is hot & dry nearly all the time
The Wadi Rum desert near Aqaba in this nation was a filming location for "Dune: Part One" & "Part Two"
This dry place partly in Pakistan's southeast is also called the Great Indian Desert
Endodontists swear that this procedure to remove infected pulp doesn't deserve its painful rep, but floss & brush to avoid needing it!
In this disease of the central nervous system, fatty tissue called myelin is destroyed & forms the disease's namesake scar tissue
Bring Jennings & Gilbert LLP your claim of this cancer from asbestos exposure, named for a layer of tissue over internal organs
Newer research suggests that cutting calories doesn't actually ease symptoms of PCOS, short for this syndrome
A hallmark of osteoporosis is a Dowager's hump, a forward rounding of the back with this medical name from the Greek
The Robertson family endured for 38 days largely on onions & turtle blood after one of these "lethal" beasts sank their yacht
Including Conwy, Caerphilly & Caldicot, Wales is said to have more of these structures per square mile than any European nation
9 days before JFK died, he gave a whale's tooth to this reclusive actress at a White House dinner
One of these annual Welsh competitions of bards & minstrels attracts more than 6,000 competitors & includes dance, drama & art
This traditional instrument resembling a violin has a 5-letter name & like other Welsh words, seemingly no vowels
"Stars" is an Act One song by Javert in this blockbuster musical
This bestselling novel by Nicholas Sparks is the basis for a musical about the enduring love of Noah & Allie
Lerner & Loewe used "The Once & Future King" as the basis for this classic musical
Tulsa in 1967 is the setting for this musical that like the source novel, features the Socs & the Greasers
It doesn't seem like the most obvious choice, but his 1991 novel "American Psycho" was briefly a Broadway musical in 2016
A question, in this novel: "Do you ever read any of the books you burn?" The reply--"That's against the law!"
"Some mega-industrialist tycoon" is all we are prepared to quote from this novel, the 1st in an E.L. James trilogy
Kathy Reichs came up with this many "Bones", typically the amount found in adult humans
Mcwatt, Kid Sampson & Nately don't see the end of this satirical World War II-set novel
Salem, Massachusetts is the setting for this Nathaniel Hawthorne novel inspired by a curse placed on his own family

rounds.text: An early version of this app was called Matchbox but that name was too similar to another company that offered the same service
